sessions.description:
We'll break out into our three production teams (currently known as Organizing, Content, Convenings). 

In this first breakout session, we'll develop a shared understanding of our team's production focus as it related to MLN goals. 

In this or later sessions, we connect with program stakeholders to better understand their challenges and opportunities. We will then dig into the H2 projects, understand the objectives, and identify blockers, dependencies, major milestones, and opportunities to test before we invest.

Required attendees: Ali, Alan, Gideon, Mavis, Sabrina, Pomax, Gavin, Kristina, Luke, Abby, Chris

sessions.description:
Pamela will explain basic financial knowledge, including:
• Broad stroke explanation of financial terms and reports
• Review a GL data dump of an expense account and show them how to understand it and what it is useful for.
• Show how salaries of people are split and why it matters.
• Review a YTD income statement compared to budget and what can be interpreted from it
• Do a section on how delay in expense reporting or errors impact reporting and daily tasks
• Explain why Grant reporting is different than regular and what gets done with the info 

Required attendees: Pamela
sessions.title: Increasing Financial Literacy (10am)

sessions.description:
NOTE THIS WILL BE IN THE CONNECTED DEVICES HOMEROOM

Are you interested in learning & making away from keyboard? This zone will be kitted out with hardware, craft materials and other rapid prototyping tools to help you take your idea from post-it to reality.

Bring a fresh idea hatched at the all-hands, or something you've been mulling over for a while, and we'll help you turn it into something physical that helps others understand, interact with and improve it. 

We'll also share reflections on prototyping practices we've been experimenting with and invite others to share their triumphs and challenges in these efforts as well.

sessions.description:
Get the key folks across MoFo working on harvesting & sharing stories together to:
 1. get everyone on the same page what the projects are on-going, and
 2. identify opportunities/practices that will enable us to collaborate & ensure we're working together effectively

Projects involved include:
 - MLN Story Engine
 - Issues Radar
 - State of the Web
 - Network Pulse
 - Advocacy media

sessions.description:
Anyone who is interested in learning how the Mozilla Learning Team teaches core web literacy leadership skills - using Web Literacy Map as the blueprint.

4:30 pm in Lancaster / Metropole East Tower
sessions.title: Growing Web Literacy Leaders

sessions.description:
This session will discuss how we cultivated a conversation regarding building an open internet and it's barriers to participation. We pro-typed this workshop at the Allied Media Conference in 2015 where we were able to utilize the high degree of diversity in the attendee population. 

4:30pm in Hilton Meeting Room 10 / Metropole Tower Wing
sessions.title: Make Open Internet a Reality

sessions.description:
Anyone who wants to learn more about working open, WOW stands for Working Open Workshop, and we have most of the materials on how to openly source, license, document, publish, and provide for projects on the web. We'd love to share this with our community and anyone at Mozilla who might want to fork and reproduce a similar workshop in their respective communities 

4:30pm in York / Metropole East Tower
sessions.title: Design your own "Working Open Workshop" (4:30)

sessions.description:
Greater diversity and equity is achieved through the construction of open, participatory and accessible venues for engagement. We present exemplary projects from Mozilla's Hive Chicago Learning Network as case studies, solicit and identify complementary examples from workshop participants, and lead attendees to co-construct a general model for Community-Based Co-Creation Pathways. Participants will apply and remix the model for their own communities to take home and execute. 

4:30pm in Hilton Meeting Room 11 / Metropole Tower Wing
sessions.title: Spaces, Places and People: Community Co-Creation Pathways

sessions.description:
Tinkerers interested in a hands-on exploration to generate educational resources that will activate the learning space at MozFest with internet enabled devices. 

3pm in Hilton Meeting Room 11 / Metropole Tower Wing
sessions.title: Exploring Internet Enable Devices for Learning

Old broken stuff (Hidden)

sessions.description:
We get many many requests about practical matter that may or may not be on the Mana or people just need one on one info to make things clearer. As there are many new people, this could be an easy way to get people more comfortable on the who, what, when, where and why's or operational tasks.
Topics:
• A lightening quick review of the roles of all the staff and their areas of expertise
• Why we need contracts and the quickest way to get them drafted
• How to ensure you get reimbursed for all expenses as fast as possible, using Expensify
• How to use expensify!
• What is needed to get invoices paid
• Travel Policies and why we do things in specific ways
• Org Charts; What they are, how you can use them and modifications
• Bugzilla; How to better use Buzilla
• Conference call numbers; How to get your own conference room number!

Required attendees: Pamela
sessions.title: Practical Guide to Ops at MoFo

sessions.description:
Copywriters, storytellers, and communicators from various corners of the Foundation have historically used the twice-monthly Comms Council to catch up and talk comms broadly.

In Q2 and beyond, I'm hoping we can continue in a way that's productive for all. That means sharing our work; determining how it overlaps and how we can collaborate; and workshopping items that need an extra set of eyes.
